title: How to Make a Watermelon Smoothie Using a Drill

steps.headline: Place your watermelon on a large table.
steps.description: By using the knife, make a hole in the middle of the watermelon.

steps.headline: Remove any parts from the hanger to have just the wire.
steps.description: Twist your metal coat hanger in a shape of a long water drop by using pliers or hands.

steps.headline: Place the coat hanger in the drill so it could fit properly.
See if it works - it shouldn't jam.
Turn the drill on.
steps.description: Now, place the drill's head (coat hanger) inside of the watermelon while spinning it around so the drill could blend the watermelon.

steps.headline: Take your plastic cup and cut it into the shape of the watermelon's mouth or alternatively, just cut it in half length-ways.

steps.headline: By using the knife, cut the hole into a larger semi-circle that's up-side down.
By using the Sharpie draw a face on the watermelon if desired where the hole is the mouth so when you pour the smoothie out, the opening will look like a tongue with the help from the pourer.
Cut the bottom of the watermelon if desired enough so the watermelon could stand, not roll.
Pour the watermelon in a glass carefully.
steps.description: Garnish the glass with some fruits or a watermelon, lemon etc. slice, wheel, wedge etc.

text: Place your watermelon on a large table. By using the knife, make a hole in the middle of the watermelon. Remove any parts from the hanger to have just the wire. Twist your metal coat hanger in a shape of a long water drop by using pliers or hands. Place the coat hanger in the drill so it could fit properly.  See if it works - it shouldn't jam.  Turn the drill on. Now, place the drill's head (coat hanger) inside of the watermelon while spinning it around so the drill could blend the watermelon. Take your plastic cup and cut it into the shape of the watermelon's mouth or alternatively, just cut it in half length-ways. That cup will be the pourer. It should look like this: By using the knife, cut the hole into a larger semi-circle that's up-side down.  See if the pourer (cup) fits.  By using the Sharpie draw a face on the watermelon if desired where the hole is the mouth so when you pour the smoothie out, the opening will look like a tongue with the help from the pourer.  Cut the bottom of the watermelon if desired enough so the watermelon could stand, not roll.  Pour the watermelon in a glass carefully. Garnish the glass with some fruits or a watermelon, lemon etc. slice, wheel, wedge etc. Serve and enjoy your refreshing drink!
